description: Just Another Team's recommendations for Season 16. Recommended for Mouse and Keyboard.
name: Just Another Team's MnK rolls - Season 16

data.description: For fusions in PvP, a recoil direction as close to 100 is the most important thing. Arrowhead Break and a counterbalance mod gets you to 95 rd, which pairs with Firmly Planted for an excellent recoil direction

The combo of Overflow + Focused Fury is a 6s monster, with an overflowed pulse giving multiple more bursts with which to both proc and take advantage of he damage buff of Focused Fury.

While Overflow + Moving Target is an excellent neutral game dueling roll, it’s not the only excellent thing this pulse can do in PvP. Elemental Capacitor makes it a stat monster on Arc, and grants improved strafe speed and fixes the recoil to be 100 on Stasis. The combo of Overflow + Focused Fury is a 6s monster, with an overflowed pulse giving multiple more bursts with which to both proc and take advantage of he damage buff of Focused Fury.

The crafted version of this weapon can get Enhanced Overflow, which when combined with Extended Mag can get a 16 round mag in PvE. This pairs extremely well with an Auto Loading Heavy weapon if you want to use an exotic primary, or even just as an alternative to a Triple Tap sniper to eliminate reload time (note, Triple Tap is still superior to Overflow if you hit all crits thanks to pulling ammo from thin air instead of taking from reserves)

While Under Your Skin rolls the classic combo of Archers Tempo + Explosive Head, it might be worth for some people to forgo the slight damage increase of Explosive and instead go for an Adaptive Munitions roll. This perk allows the bow to essentially ignore Match Game, as it gives an eventual 600% damage increase against non-Void elemental shields. With an Adaptive Munitions roll, you could theoretically delete all other elemental bows and only use an Under Your Skin god roll and still be just as effective. An excellent vault cleaning roll.

While it’s certainly not the best roll, this auto rifle can roll with the unique combo of Triple Tap and Fourth Times the Charm. With a maxed out magazine stat (Extended + Adept Mag) it has an effective mag of around 300 shots assuming you hit all headshots.

The famed combo of Snap + Opening returns on a low zoom sniper. With a zoom of 43, Silicon Neuroma is lower than the current average zoom while rolling the classic sniper pairing of Snap/Opening. Definitely a PvP sniper to watch out for.

Note that for some reason Adagio on this weapon doesn’t seem to slow the fire-rate. It’s currently unknown whether it’s a bug or a feature, but this weapon suggestion may change in the future.
Note that for some reason Adagio on this weapon doesn’t seem to slow the fire-rate. It’s currently unknown whether it’s a bug or a feature, but this weapon suggestion may change in the future.

Smallbore and Accurized work together to reach 60 range, important for the consistent ohk range of 6-7m on Aggressive frames. As the only Kinetic Aggressive shotgun with Elemental Capacitor, this rules the slot on an Arc subclass. However being able to keep Frenzy procc’d through constant combat in 6s or peakshooting and other chip damage methods would give a huge boost to handling and an excellent damage buff for defensive shotgunning. My personal take is for Ele cap and use a different shotgun on Arc, but if you can keep Frenzy running in those important moments this shotgun can bis for all subclasses.

Compulsive Reloader and the Omolon Foundry trait work excellently together to make proccing Reservoir Burst repeatedly super easy. Since Snorri is the only Fusion that can roll this combo it’s an excellent rare option.

This handcannon is stacked with good PvP perks, and there very nearly isn’t a bad perk combination on the weapon. The suggested EotS + Opening Shot roll is excellent for 1 on 1 dueling, giving accuracy boosts at practically every part of the gunfight, but it’s not alone at the top. Some other suggested perk combinations; EotS + Rangefinder to duel at 35m, HFG + Opening Shot for closer range primary, Compulsive Reloader + Moving Target to reduce flinch and improve passive aa as much as possible, the possibilities are tremendous. Cantana has a low recoil direction of 85 (hand canons have a floor of 80) so arrowhead would be a best in slot pick.

A pulse with a huge number of excellent PvE rolls that is let down by the horrendous archetype for both PvE and PvP. Despite it’s low damage, it rolls with Demo + Wellspring for ability builds, and Adaptive Munitions + Dbreak/Turnabout for shield breaking, but I wouldn’t use it over other pulse rifles that deal more base damage in more difficult content like GMs or Master Raids.
Horrendous archetype

For Arc, Void or Stasis; Elemental Capacitor has a exceptional effect (especially on Void), but if you want the auto rifle to be subclass agnostic then Tap the Trigger is the way to go.

Frontier’s Cry is the only 180 that can reach 140 dueling ranges thanks to Iron Reach, making it unique in that regard. Unfortunately it still suffers from the issues innate to 180s that keep them out of the meta, so I still suggest going for a Kill Clip roll to get a 3 tap cannon in the energy slot if you can only keep a single roll

As expected from raid weapons, this unique stasis Fusion is the only legendary of its type in the kinetic slot and has a massive number of good PvE combinations. Demo + AJ, Cornered + Surrounded, Compulsive Reloader + Chill Clip.

Rolls a number of good PvP combinations, making it a worthwhile pick to pair with an energy primary, but Perp Motion + Tap the Trigger and a max stability roll to give near to 100 stability is the play

Subsistence is BiS thanks to not giving a 100% return rate and thus still allowing usage of the Souldrinker innate perk (and even extending the number of possible kills) combined with either a damage or utility perk (frenzy or demo respectively) gives an excellent SMG. (Perpetual Motion would scale better into harder content, but subs still works well enough in master raids and SMGs shouldn't really be used in GMs)

PvP: it falls short of Multimach's range surpremacy but with that weapon being removed from the IB loot pool it offers an alternative for any new players. Max range and the option to extend the range further with KW or a damage perk

Move over Salvagers Salvo, a new add clear GL king has taken the crown. With the same roll as Salvagers (AA + Chain) on a weapon frame that is better for add clear, this Grenade Launcher is the go to special add clear for the foreseeable future

The Aggressive Frame Pulse Rifle returns in another raid weapon, along with it comes the old roll of Dragonfly + Damage Perk, this time with a new final column winner in One for All. This kind of roll scales extremely well (especially with OfA only needing hits), but I would personally go for Rapid Hit or Demo to better utilise your abilities or for a huge reload boost respectively

The best LFR for solo play, and excellent ammo economy thanks to FTTC. Bait and Switch is an easy to active damage buff which synergizes expertly with other good damage special weapons like Izanagi's or Witherhoard, making Cataclysmic one of the best LFRs in the game.

Rolls a number of good PvP combinations, making it a worthwhile pick to pair with an energy primary, but Perp Motion + Tap the Trigger and a max stability roll to give near to 100 stability is the play

Subsistence is BiS thanks to not giving a 100% return rate and thus still allowing usage of the Souldrinker innate perk (and even extending the number of possible kills) combined with either a damage or utility perk (frenzy or demo respectively) gives an excellent SMG. (Perpetual Motion would scale better into harder content, but subs still works well enough in master raids and SMGs shouldn't really be used in GMs)

PvP: it falls short of Multimach's range surpremacy but with that weapon being removed from the IB loot pool it offers an alternative for any new players. Max range and the option to extend the range further with KW or a damage perk

Move over Salvagers Salvo, a new add clear GL king has taken the crown. With the same roll as Salvagers (AA + Chain) on a weapon frame that is better for add clear, this Grenade Launcher is the go to special add clear for the foreseeable future

The Aggressive Frame Pulse Rifle returns in another raid weapon, along with it comes the old roll of Dragonfly + Damage Perk, this time with a new final column winner in One for All. This kind of roll scales extremely well (especially with OfA only needing hits), but I would personally go for Rapid Hit or Demo to better utilise your abilities or for a huge reload boost respectively

The best LFR for solo play, and excellent ammo economy thanks to FTTC. Bait and Switch is an easy to active damage buff which synergizes expertly with other good damage special weapons like Izanagi's or Witherhoard, making Cataclysmic one of the best LFRs in the game.
